intro: Allocarya areolata, commonly known as the spotted rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are often covered in small, raised dots or glands, giving it a distinctive appearance. Allocarya areolata is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
